##      About me

[![C programming language](https://img.shields.io/badge/C-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
[![Python programming language](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
[![Fortran programming language](https://img.shields.io/badge/Fortran-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
[![Julia programming
language](https://img.shields.io/badge/Julia-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
[![Matlab programming language](https://img.shields.io/badge/Matlab-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)

I'm a northeastern Brazilian student, who early became fascinated with marvelous strangeness presented by nature. This passion by counterintuitive phenomena led me to an undergraduate course in **Physics**, in which I worked as a scientific initiation student in **computational physics projects**, and the unique capabilities of computing techniques to unveil hidden aspects of nature changed entirely my world-view. Toward the end of my undergraduate studies in Physics, I found myself in **optics**, where I can research both **fundamental physics** and **novel computing paradigms** (such as **quantum computing**) and their applications. Along my academic journey, I've learned programming languages such as `C`, my native language on computing, `Fortran` and `Python`, besides some minor experiences with `Matlab` and `Julia`. Nowadays, besides a **MsC student** in **Condensed Matter Physics**, I'm an **early undergraduate student** in **Computer Engineering**, hoping to integrate knowledge from both fields to gain a distinct perspective.

</div>

###     Research interests and prospects

I am profoundly eager to understand more deeply novel quantum technologies (*QT*) and to explore machine learning (*ML*). I have some minor experiences towards *QT*, but in the early future I aspire to mainly focus in **quantum communication protocols**, through **photonic devices** (the research area of interest of my current [**research group - GON**](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&opi=89978449&url=https://if.ufal.br/grupopesquisa/gon/index.html&ved=2ahUKEwjBxJD5lq6MAxU4G7kGHcZgOBcQFnoECAsQAQ&usg=AOvVaw3c4_bvNhww8siSGqntr7r4)), and **quantum-safe cryptografic protocols**. As future prospects, I hope to being fully integrated to my research group and improve my computational, theoretical and experimental skills to provide a simple and efficient computational framework capable to simlate classical and quantum behavior of light while it interacts with **photonic devices**.

The repository is written in Brazilian Portuguese (my native human language).

####    Class notes or problem sets

>   [**Programation I**](https://github.com/carlos-antunis-physics/programacao-I)
>
>   [![C programming language](https://img.shields.io/badge/C-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
>   >
>   >  This repository has the aim to gather source-codes developed by myself while I'm studying my Programation I course as undergraduate student in Computer Engineering at IC - UFAL. The repository is written in Brazilian Portuguese (my native human language) with some examples of code from [the huxley](https://thehuxley.com/), platform where the problems were posed, developed as exercises.

>   [**Notes on partial differential equations**](https://github.com/carlos-antunis-physics/notes-on-partial-differential-equations)
>
>   
>   [![Julia programming
language](https://img.shields.io/badge/Julia-efefef.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,&style=flat)](#---)
>   >
>   >   This repository assembles my class notes during the Minicourse on [Partial Differential Equations](https://www.ictp-saifr.org/mpde2025/), which aims to introduce the robustness and the wideness of Differential Equations and its applications. As a Physics MSc student, whose research area is optics, my focus on this class notes is mainly applying the mathematical and computational tools taught in the minicourse onto waveguide and nonlinear optics (my main interests in classical optics).
